text:
Premier League
Liverpool: 100th for Trent Alexander-Arnold
The young left side of the Reds celebrated his 21 years last month. The scouser started his career early with Liverpool and made his 100th appearance this Saturday against Aston Villa with JÃ¼rgen Klopp.
02 Nov 2019, 16:00 by Nils Constant



In a press conference on Friday, the German technician praised his side: "He is so young and yet so experienced, I wish he stays healthy, in good shape and that the future is bright for him as for us. At just 21 years old, the Liverpool child will play his 100th game in the Reds' jersey, demonstrating the mental and physical strength of this player who has played in two Champions League finals two consecutive seasons and continues to progress at his post . Over time, he became indisputable holder on his flank.




Impressive statistics




Trent Alexander-Arnold +3 ğŸ“·Credit Photo - Icon Sport

The figures show the quality and impact of the international English on the game of his team. Author of twelve assists last season in the league, Alexander-Arnold brings a lot to Liverpool's offensive line. This season he is alone in the league table with the most goal chances with 37 goals in the middle of Manchester City, Kevin De Bruyne. Liverpool's iconic defender Jamie Carragher looks back at the young defenseman's prowess: "There is no doubt he can play in the middle, I was a defender - I'm certainly not up to it. of Trent - and you receive a lot of balloons because you are free. "
Trent Alexander-Arnold joined Liverpool at the age of six and made his first appearance in October 2016. Known for his quick corner against Barcelona in the Champions League semi-finals allowing JÃ¼rgen Klopp's men to qualify, English can claim a bright future on the banks of the Mersey if it remains on this beautiful start.
